08:51 <vmassol> good morning  
08:51 <vmassol> I need some help on something I don't understandz  
08:51 <acotiuga> good morning!  
08:51 <vmassol> I have the following code:  
08:51 \* vmassol sent a long message: vmassol\_2017-04-18\_06:51:30.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/WASsMbRnwVlVUtkrJBxxRPnK  
08:52 <vmassol> in getChanges, I do:   #setVariable("$xvariable" $changeItems) where #set ($xvariable = $xcontext.macro.params.contextVariable)  
08:52 <vmassol> and in displaychanges I do: #set ($xvariable = $xcontext.macro.params.contextVariable) and #set ($changeItems = $xcontext.get('vcontext').get($xvariable))  
08:52 <vmassol> that works fine for the 2 macros  
08:53 <vmassol> however it doesn't work for the code between the 2 macro calls  
08:53 <vmassol> I get:  
08:53 <gavin1> has quit  
08:53 <vmassol> AAA $userChanges  
08:53 <vmassol> BBB $xcontext.get('vcontext').get('userChanges')  
08:53 <vmassol> CCC org.apache.velocity.VelocityContext@7499a8ba  
08:54 <vmassol> so the userChanges var is not in the velocity conterxt  
08:54 <vmassol> FTR I'm also printing the velocity contexts inside the 2 macros and they're using the same velocity context instance  
08:54 <vmassol> anhy idea? :)  
08:56 <gavin1> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <gavin1> has quit

09:21 <tmortagne> vmassol: order issue, put wiki=false in you {{veclocity}} and you will understand  
09:21 <vmassol> ahhhhhh stupid me  
09:21 <vmassol> thanks!  
09:21 <vmassol> grrrrr

09:54 <AntoineMOREL> Hello, I have troubles with the Activity Stream : "Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Cause: [Table 'xwiki.activitystream\_events\_targets' doesn't exist]."  
09:54 <AntoineMOREL> https://pastebin.com/10WsgLD1  
09:55 <AntoineMOREL> may you help me please?

13:37 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <AntoineMOREL> Hello, since I switched to version 9.2, I have problems with the Activity Stream which displays the following error message:  
13:38 <AntoineMOREL> Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Cause: [Table 'xwiki.activitystream\_events\_targets' doesn't exist].  
13:38 <AntoineMOREL> https://pastebin.com/n5nNhYrb  
13:39 <AntoineMOREL> I have however updated all extensions from extension manager  
13:39 <vmassol> Hi AntoineMOREL  
13:39 <vmassol> it seems your DB schema was not updated  
13:39 <gavin> has quit  
13:39 <tmortagne> AntoineMOREL: looks like you are missing a mapping in hibernate.xfg.xml  
13:39 <tmortagne> AntoineMOREL: looks like you are missing a mapping in hibernate.cfg.xml  
13:40 <msmeria> has quit  
13:40 <vmassol> btw how did you upgrade?  
13:41 <vmassol> could it be that you copied the new WAR over the old WAR?  
13:41 \* tmortagne sent a long message: tmortagne\_2017-04-18\_11:41:28.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/mDlaVWyyEvWIqtXHnIefLoQl  
13:42 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <tmortagne> also make sure you enabled xwiki.store.migration in xwiki.cfg file  
13:44 <AntoineMOREL> Thank you for your help ! I'll keep you informed  
13:45 <AntoineMOREL> @vmassol Yes, i copied the new WAR over the old WAR  
13:45 <gavin> has quit  
13:46 <vmassol> ok so that's not correct at all :)  
13:46 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Upgrade  
13:46 <vmassol> and especially http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Upgrade#HUpgradingthewebapp  
13:47 <vmassol> so you now have some duplicate jars in WEB-INF/lib probably  
13:47 <vmassol> which will cause all sort of problems  
13:47 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <vmassol> (AntoineMOREL)  
13:49 <gavin> has quit  
13:50 <vmassol> lunch time, bb in 30mn  
13:52 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <AntoineMOREL> Okay, thank you ;)  
13:54 <gavin> has quit

14:22 <gavin> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <AntoineMOREL> Should i keep the xwiki.store.migration on "hibernate"?  
14:23 <vmassol> it's a boolean!  
14:23 <vmassol> #-# Whether schema updates and migrations are enabled or not. Should be enabled when upgrading, but for a better  
14:23 <vmassol> #-# startup time it is better to disable them in production.  
14:23 <vmassol> xwiki.store.migration=1  
14:24 <vmassol> in your case this won't help anyway  
14:24 <vmassol> but yes you must always enable the migration when upgrading  
14:24 <vmassol> in your case you need  to reinstall XWiki cleanly  
14:24 <gavin> has quit  
14:26 <AntoineMOREL> D'acc, thx
